text: <@U032CFPNYCQ> has joined the channel
Are betting syndicates registered companies that declare their gambling profit as a taxable income?? Speaking from a UK perspective here as gambling non-taxable currently?

elements.text: Are betting syndicates registered companies that declare their gambling profit as a taxable income?? Speaking from a UK perspective here as gambling non-taxable currently?

text: No, they'll be set up as more complex structures so they don't pay tax on their gambling winnings. For example, a registered software company which licenses out betting software which makes no profit, and separate unregistered betting syndicate which does the gambling and pays no tax. Something like that anyway.

elements.text: No, they'll be set up as more complex structures so they don't pay tax on their gambling winnings. For example, a registered software company which licenses out betting software which makes no profit, and separate unregistered betting syndicate which does the gambling and pays no tax. Something like that anyway.

text: So the commercial element runs at a loss and the owners/members of the syndicate take that on the chin via gambling profits?

elements.text: So the commercial element runs at a loss and the owners/members of the syndicate take that on the chin via gambling profits?

text: Better to run the company at a profit otherwise as running it at a loss while the syndicate is raking in money is quite dodgy

elements.text: Better to run the company at a profit otherwise as running it at a loss while the syndicate is raking in money is quite dodgy

text: But how do you run a company at a profit with no product? Sorry if these are naive questions

elements.text: But how do you run a company at a profit with no product? Sorry if these are naive questions

text: Well the commercial element probably runs at net zero profit or very low profit. (Charges syndicate as much as needed to pay salaries and overheads).

elements.text: Well the commercial element probably runs at net zero profit or very low profit. (Charges syndicate as much as needed to pay salaries and overheads).

text: The product is the “software” or IP.

elements.text: The product is the “software” or IP.

text: OK I see. So who "owns" the company? Syndicate members?

elements.text: OK I see. So who "owns" the company? Syndicate members?

text: Probably a subset of the senior syndicate members. Depends how big the syndicate is I guess. Anyway, I'm sure <@UBS7QANF3> knows more than me!

elements.text: Probably a subset of the senior syndicate members. Depends how big the syndicate is I guess. Anyway, I'm sure
knows more than me!

text: OK thanks for the responses. I'm just trying to think of some ways I can join the "real world" again from a career perspective without working for anyone else but not paying tax on my winnings.

elements.text: OK thanks for the responses. I'm just trying to think of some ways I can join the "real world" again from a career perspective without working for anyone else but not paying tax on my winnings.

text: You don't need to worry if you're an individual gambler…

elements.text: You don't need to worry if you're an individual gambler…

text: I do if it all goes to shit a year from now and I have an 18 month gap on my CV

elements.text: I do if it all goes to shit a year from now and I have an 18 month gap on my CV

text: Only need to think about the structure if you want to form or join a team.

elements.text: Only need to think about the structure if you want to form or join a team.

text: Just say the truth. I've been betting systematically for nearly 12 years and I get head hunters all the time! They are valuable skills.

elements.text: Just say the truth. I've been betting systematically for nearly 12 years and I get head hunters all the time! They are valuable skills.

text: So you pay no NI no tax and not employed for 12 years and live solely off betting income AND still get headhunted?

elements.text: So you pay no NI no tax and not employed for 12 years and live solely off betting income AND still get headhunted?

text: Yeah… They probably find me through my LinkedIn profile. Or I'm just on their record from years ago.

elements.text: Yeah… They probably find me through my LinkedIn profile. Or I'm just on their record from years ago.

text: Interesting. Did it feel strange to you when you started? Being totally off the radar so to speak?

elements.text: Interesting. Did it feel strange to you when you started? Being totally off the radar so to speak?

text: If you have a 18 month gap on your CV but have been doing something productive, which you will have been, then I don't see that as a problem at all.

elements.text: If you have a 18 month gap on your CV but have been doing something productive, which you will have been, then I don't see that as a problem at all.

text: No, not really. But it's not for everyone. Working alone is solitary by definition. Some people like working in a team and in an office. But some people are fine with it. Some people prefer to form syndicates. Some people just interacting with the community like this one is enough.

elements.text: No, not really. But it's not for everyone. Working alone is solitary by definition. Some people like working in a team and in an office. But some people are fine with it. Some people prefer to form syndicates. Some people just interacting with the community like this one is enough.

text: OK sounds like all I have to worry about is mortgages and affordability checks then.

elements.text: OK sounds like all I have to worry about is mortgages and affordability checks then.

text: Yeah, you won't ever get a mortgage once you have no taxable income. So make sure you're sorted on that side of things already. And obviously make sure you have some cushion in case you do need to get a job again.

elements.text: Yeah, you won't ever get a mortgage once you have no taxable income. So make sure you're sorted on that side of things already. And obviously make sure you have some cushion in case you do need to get a job again.

text: OK thanks for that. Very helpful indeed.

elements.text: OK thanks for that. Very helpful indeed.

text: Just realised I posted this in the wrong channel thought I was in random.

elements.text: Just realised I posted this in the wrong channel thought I was in random.

text: In our case, yes the syndicate members are shareholders in the company

elements.text: In our case, yes the syndicate members are shareholders in the company

text: Just to echo <@USYQKE5HN>, I don't think you have anything to worry about from an employability perspective. I certainly wouldn't leave a gap on your CV. Developing automated betting strategies involves various highly desirable skills

elements.text: Just to echo

, I don't think you have anything to worry about from an employability perspective. I certainly wouldn't leave a gap on your CV. Developing automated betting strategies involves various highly desirable skills

text: OK cheers Mo

elements.text: OK cheers Mo

text: Yeah, exactly. Don't actually leave a gap on your CV. Just say what you've been doing during that period. I think I say “Systematic automated betting” or something similar and list all the skills used/learnt.

elements.text: Yeah, exactly. Don't actually leave a gap on your CV. Just say what you've been doing during that period. I think I say “Systematic automated betting” or something similar and list all the skills used/learnt.

text: OK thanks. Obviously hope it never comes to that just trying to be a realist.

elements.text: OK thanks. Obviously hope it never comes to that just trying to be a realist.

text: Yeah, it's good that you're thinking ahead and considering all the possible outcomes though.

elements.text: Yeah, it's good that you're thinking ahead and considering all the possible outcomes though.

text: "Be interesting to find out if we do all get the same timestamps". We don't. I looked at some data for somebody on here a while back and after comparing it to mine for the same market, that was one of the takeaways.
